Captain Syrezeaju 05-Dec-20 08:18 PM
The flooring was cold against bare feet. It was cold like the interior of that room had been. Room, not room, room that hadn't been a room it had been the shuttle, the interior of there. It was to the surprise and perhaps concern of the other officers walking down this corridor that she emerged from medical in what was evidently a hurry. Stumbling, she caught herself upon the wall before continuing onwards at the fastest walk she could muster, using the wall for support. Other officers seemed to move out of the way but gave concerned looks to one another. She thought they were concerned. It was so difficult to make out the details and now... And now... She shook her head to try to stave off the darkness which seemed to be creeping in at the edges of her vision. Where was she going to go? If she crawled into the jefferies tubes then she would have access to the entirety of the ship, but even in this state fuelled solely by adrenaline she knew that there was no way she could make it to another deck without falling to her death. For a very brief moment - and rather horribly - the thought did cross her mind, considering how if she did die from the fall then at least she would not die at the hands of her captors. But if she got away... If she took one of their shuttles then she could ping their location. She could warn the fleet, these people could be apprehended, and, and- Why was it so hard to think? There were voices calling from behind her but she couldn't hear them any more. They rang through her head like the sound of a gong, akin to being stood right next to one as it was struck. The turbolift was just ahead. She could make it. She could make it...
